page.title: 17Steelworks Reclamation Site
page.content: {British Steel}closed its{Consett works in 1980 leaving economic chaos and an industrial eyesore of a 140 hectares. The reclamation work is now well into the third of four phases.Completion of this project,currently{the biggest {undertaken in Europe,}is scheduled for an approximate overall cost of Â£3-Â£4m. .Completion implies the setting of the land form with drainage and strong fencing. Prospective uses of the site include{industry}in the form of small factories,{agriculture,}both arable and pastural.{Recreational}activities such as football and skiing. Tree plantations will lend the area a pleasant aspect. Possibly the major problem faced by engineer Mr. Sheperd is contamination of the population from poisons like Mercury and Cyanide. The project is financed by{Dept. of {Environment's}derelect land allocation
